description.narrative:
Fisheries Action Coalition Team (FACT), a national NGO, working around the Tonle Sap, coastal and the Mekong region on issues that affect fishing communities# livelihoods. FACT#s programs support communities, community-based organisations and networks, including Cambodian Coalition of Fishers/. Through its work, FACT also engages directly # and facilitates community and NGO dialogues with # other key stakeholders, particularly the government, to discuss policies and practices related to fisheries. FACT has helped convenedand participated in numerous multi-stakeholder forums to strengthen cooperation in fisheries management in Cambodia. FACT#s goal isto equip the Coalitions of Cambodian Fishers and NGOs with the necessary capacities to implement their activities effectively and ensure that the voice of fishers are heard and supported.
FACT has established and supported 116 Community-based organizations and community fisheries nation-wide. FACT has mobilized and built up CBO#s capacity to enhance their ownership in fishery resources management. FACT also works to promote community awareness and advocate for positive changes. In addition, FACT engages the CBOs to improve their livelihoods and good governance through better understanding of the implementation and enforcement of fisheries law. However, the capacities of CBOs still need to be strengthened. Based on the annual internal assessment conducted by FACT, only approximately 50%-55% of all 116 CBOs/CFis are strongly proficient in institutional management, communication, networking and advocacy. Capacity development is a main vehicle for CBOs to gain ownership and fullfil their rights to access the natural resources in sustainable way.
Oxfam water governance funds FACT to implement the project called #Strengthening capacity of Fishers# Network and NGO coalition towards fisheries resources sustainability and ownership in the Mekong and Tonle Sap regions.# Oxfam water governance project has decided to fund FACT on building the capacities of community fisheries and CSO network to engage in national fishery policy influencing.

participating-org.narrative: Fisheries Action Coalition Team (FACT) is a coalition of NGOs established in 2000 by a group of NGO members working on fisheries and environmental issues around the Tonle Sap Lake. It was established as part of the environment project of the NGO Forum onCambodia.At that time, a group of NGOs interested in fisheries issues formed a sub-working group which then was supported by different international NGOs such as Oxfam, NGO Forum on Cambodia, and Environment Justice-Foundation. The group of eight NGOs later decided to form the Fisheries Action Coalition Team. In January 2004, FACT separated forum the NGO Forum on Cambodia following the reform in fisheries sector of Cambodia, in which the government declared to release up to 56% of the commercial fishinglots to community management. FACT#s active members are all Cambodian NGO staff members who are committed to conducting advocacy in fisheries issues and monitoring policy reforms. FACT#s program mobilizes provincial NGOs and Community Based Organizations(CBOs) to more effective conduct advocacy programs that respond to development policies and development programs. FACT focuses its work around the Tonle Sap, Coastal and Mekong provinces, on issues that affect Cambodian communities# livelihoods. FACT collaborates with NGOs concerned with fisheries involved with local fishing communities. FACT works towards building a strong coalition of NGOs and local grassroots# organizations to protect fisheries, water resources and other natural resources in Tonle SapLake, Mekong River, and Cambodian marine regions along the coastal provinces.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
